result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry Matthews

records.addlTxt: Signed by Judge Paul F. Reilly
Motion to forfeit bail granted.

10:55 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon in court.   Defendant Terry Matthews did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Reider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. McMahon advises she has no information as to why the defendant has not appeared today, but notes he does have transporation issues.  Atty. McMahon is asking the court to not issue a capias today and hold off to another date for status.  Court notes the defendant has failed to appear at previous court hearings.  State is asking the court to issue a capias and bail be forfeited and revoked as this is not the first time the defendant has failed to appear.  Atty. McMahon presents additional statements and is again asking the court to not issue a capias today.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will issue a capias and order bail be forfeited.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:53 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Luis Gutierrez for attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon in court.   Defendant Terry Matthews did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests capias.  Atty. Gutierrez objects.  Defendant was present at court the last hearing and was given the court date then.  Court will issue a capias and orders bail be forfeited.

Case recalled at 11:33 AM; all appearances remain the same.  Defendant Terry Matthews is now present in court.  Court will quash the capias and reinstate the bail.  Court reminds the defendant he needs to appear on time for furture court dates.  Atty. Gutierrez advises that Atty. McMahon is requesting a further proceedings date in July or August.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: appointing Attorney Maura McMahon
Hearing on June 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:07 AM Defendant Terry Matthews in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.
  Hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on May 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

02:09 PM Defendant Terry Matthews in court, in custody.   State Public Defender Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
The Defendant presents statements as to his non appearance at prior court date.
The State gives its bail recommendation.
The Court quashes the warrant.  Hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.

03:22 PM Defendant Terry Matthews not in court.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court orders the warrant remain in effect.

For Non-Appearance.
Body ONLY.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Sydney Star, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Terry Matthews not in court. 
Case scheduled for 1:30 pm. and Matter called @ 2:49 pm.

State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail.
Court orders warrant be issued.
Bail is revoked and forfeited.
Body ONLY.
Pre-trial conference on February 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

01:28 PM Defendant Terry Matthews in court, in custody, with attorney Cassandra A Miller.    Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office.  
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
